intro: Montrouziera sphaeroidea, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white, fluffy flowers that resemble snowballs, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a striking addition to gardens and landscapes.
